doc:
Luz Márquez https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luz_M%C3%A1rquez 0 Luz Marquez (born María de la O García Márquez Soler; 12 December 1935 in Madrid, Spain), is a Spanish actress whose brief but intense acting career lasted ten years from 1956 to 1966. She appeared in more than 35 films, including Manolo Guardia Urbano (1956), 15 Bajo la Lona (1959), Adventures of the Bengal Lancers (1964), and the Audie Murphy film The Texican (1966). Marquez is best known for her role as Julia in the popular 1958 musical romance Las Chicas de la Cruz Roja (English: Red Cross Girls). Luz_Marquez ( born_María_de_la_O_García_Márquez_Soler ; 12_December_1935 in Madrid , Spain ) , is a_Spanish_actress whose_brief but intense_acting_career lasted ten_years from 1956 to 1966 . She appeared in more_than_35_films , including Manolo_Guardia_Urbano_(_1956_) , 15_Bajo_la_Lona_(_1959_) , Adventures of the_Bengal_Lancers_(_1964_) , and the_Audie_Murphy_film The_Texican_(_1966_) . Marquez is_best_known for her_role as Julia in the_popular_1958_musical_romance_Las_Chicas_de_la_Cruz_Roja_(_English : Red_Cross_Girls_) .
